answers.answer: The nystatin should help resolve the thrush issue.Antibiotic usage can result in thrush as a side effect.  What happens is that the antibiotics are great at killing bacteria but doesn't do anything to the fungus.  As the bacteria are being killed off, there's more room and less competition for the fungus to grow and so it can spread and become an infection.  If you're perfectly healthy, it shouldn't come back again unless antibiotics are taken again possibly.
